In the years between 1980, when the it was first invented and 2009, 350 million Rubik's Cubes have been sold. Whilst there have been variations on the puzzle , the white, red, orange, yellow, blue and green faces remains as the cube's iconic image.
A number of lawsuits concerning patent rights has happened over the year, with the first being that of Larry Nichols , who had invented a 2x2x2 puzzle , for which he gained the patent, 2 years prior to Rubik.
As for the puzzle itself, the permutations of positions number 43 Quintillion, with the record for the fastest solution being held by Erik Akkersdijk of the Netherlands with a time of 7.08 seconds.
